node.title: Donald Trump Torches Benjamin Netanyahu for Congratulating Joe Biden on Electionâ€”'F*** Him'
node.alt: In this photo provided by the Israeli government press office, Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump speak at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv on May 23, 2017. Their friendship now appears to have faltered.
node.description: Donald Trump launched a tirade against the former Israeli prime minister in interviews for a book by journalist Barak Ravid.
node.content:
["Donald Trump has launched a foul-mouthed attack on Benjamin Netanyahu in an interview, claiming he has not spoken with Netanyahu since the former Israeli prime minister congratulated President Joe Biden on his election victory.", "According to journalist Barak Ravid, who conducted two interviews with the former president for his book Trump's Peace: The Abraham Accords and the Reshaping of the Middle East, Trump described feeling let down because Netanyahu did not support his false claims of voter fraud in the 2020 election. Ravid said Trump added: \"F*** him.\"", "On January 20, Netanyahu congratulated Biden on his \"historic\" inauguration, adding that the pair had a \"warm personal friendship going back many decades.\"", "According to transcripts released by Ravid, Trump told the journalist: \"Nobody did more for Bibi. And I liked Bibi. I still like Bibi,\" referring to Netanyahu by his nickname. \"But I also like loyalty.\"", "Trump also wrongly states that Netanyahu was one of the first people to congratulate Biden on his victory. In fact, the Israeli prime minister waited several hours after the election was called for Biden to congratulate him and his message arrived after greetings from a number of other world leaders.", "\"The first person to congratulate Biden was Bibi. And not only did he congratulate him, he did it on tape. And it was on tape.", "\"The first person who congratulated Joe Biden, because this was an election in dispute, it's still in dispute. The first person who congratulated was Bibi Netanyahu, the man that I did more for than any other person I dealt with.\"", "Trump added: \"Bibi could have stayed quiet. He has made a terrible mistake.", "\"He was very early. Like earlier than most. I haven't spoken to him since. F**k him.\"", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available. ", "", "
In this photo provided by the Israeli government press office, Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump speak at Ben Gurion International Airport in Tel Aviv on May 23, 2017. Their friendship now appears to have faltered.
"]
